intro: Saracha vestita, commonly known as the naked saracha, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in high-altitude regions, where it thrives in cool, moist environments. Its leaves are slender and finely divided, while its flowers are small and clustered in umbels. Saracha vestita is valued for its medicinal properties and has been used traditionally in local remedies.
